I need to delete a carboxyl functional group from the provided SMILES string. Let me analyze the molecule and identify all carboxyl groups (-COOH or -C(=O)O-).

Looking at the SMILES string `COC(=O)c1ccc(NC(=O)C2CCN(C(=O)O)CC2)cc1`, I can identify:

1. Methyl ester at the beginning: `COC(=O)-`
2. Amide: `-NC(=O)-`
3. Carbamate: `-N(C(=O)O)-`

The carboxyl group (-COOH) is typically represented as `-C(=O)O` in SMILES. In this molecule, the carbamate group `-N(C(=O)O)` contains a carboxyl-like structure. This appears to be a Boc protecting group on the nitrogen of the piperidine ring.

I'll remove this carbamate group and replace it with a hydrogen on the nitrogen.

```
Original: COC(=O)c1ccc(NC(=O)C2CCN(C(=O)O)CC2)cc1
Modified: COC(=O)c1ccc(NC(=O)C2CCNCC2)cc1
```

{"output": "COC(=O)c1ccc(NC(=O)C2CCNCC2)cc1"}
